doc:
Kester Berwick https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kester_Berwick 0 Kester Berwick (1903–1992) was born in Adelaide and died an expatriate on Corfu in the Greek islands. Born Frank Perkins, he took the name Kester Baruch because a friend told him that would sound "less plebeian", then changed it again at the beginning of World War II when he was living in Switzerland. An Australian actor and writer, Berwick, who was gay, spent the final 23 years of his life in Greece. His life is the subject of one of the storylines in Robert Dessaix's novel Corfu. Kester_Berwick ( 1903 – 1992 ) was_born in Adelaide and died an_expatriate on Corfu in the_Greek_islands . Born Frank_Perkins , he took the_name_Kester_Baruch because a_friend told him that would_sound " less_plebeian_" , then changed it again at the_beginning of World_War_II when he was_living in Switzerland . An_Australian_actor_and_writer , Berwick , who was gay , spent the_final_23_years of his_life in Greece . His_life is the_subject of one of the_storylines in Robert_Dessaix 's_novel_Corfu .
